name: Mehndi
description: Discover the timeless elegance of Mehndi. From intricate bridal designs to contemporary patterns, our artists craft stunning henna art that tells a unique story on your skin.

processSteps.title: Consultation

processSteps.title: Artistic Application

processSteps.title: Aftercare Guidance

blogPosts.title: The Symbolism Behind Traditional Mehndi Motifs

blogPosts.title: 5 Tips for a Darker, Longer-Lasting Henna Stain
blogPosts.description: Learn the secrets from our expert artists on how to care for your mehndi to achieve that coveted deep, dark stain that lasts.

careTips.title: Avoid Water Initially
careTips.description: For the first 12-24 hours, avoid contact with water as much as possible to allow the henna stain to fully develop.

careTips.title: Keep It Warm
careTips.description: Heat helps the henna stain darken. Keep the area warm, but avoid direct heat sources that could cause sweating.

careTips.title: Scrape, Don't Wash
careTips.description: Once the paste is dry and crumbly, gently scrape it off. Do not wash it off with water for the best results.

faqs.question: How long does the mehndi application take?
faqs.answer: Application time varies depending on the complexity of the design. A simple design can take 30-45 minutes, while intricate bridal mehndi can take 4-6 hours.

faqs.question: Is your henna paste safe for sensitive skin?
faqs.answer: Yes, we make our own henna paste using 100% organic henna powder, essential oils, and lemon juice. It is free from harmful chemicals like PPD.

faqs.question: How long will my mehndi stain last?
faqs.answer: With proper aftercare, a mehndi stain can last anywhere from 1 to 3 weeks, gradually fading over time as your skin naturally exfoliates.
